subtitle: Potjiekos are South African stews cooked in a 'potjie' - a round bellied 3 legged iron pot hung over an open fire. Often the legs were sewn down so that it could also be used on a black coal stove. The rounded base ensured that the juices accumulated at the base of the pot near the heat, cooking the stew to perfection. We suggest you use a large pan on the hob!

method.text: Melt the butter with the oil in a large saucepan. Add the onion, garlic, coriander, cayenne pepper, cinnamon and celery and fry together for 3 min or until softened.
Stir the rice into the pan and cook for 2 min.
Stir in the tomato puree and lemon juice. Slowly add the wine, stirring constantly until all is incorporated. Season to taste.

Add the bay leaves to the pan. Bring to the boil and simmer for 5 min. Stir in the monkfish. Place the mussels and tiger prawn on top.  Cover and cook over a low heat, without stirring, for 15-20 min.
Adjust seasoning. Discard any mussels that haven't opened. Sprinkle over the basil. Remove the bay leaves and serve.

title: Seafood potjie
